review_title: Senior Vice President Senior Executive Assistant II
pros: The School is good for the community.
cons: Not enough money to get the college to where it needs to be

pros: Holiday's are great. Good students can do remote.
cons: Not enough pay, a lot of responsibilities.

pros: Summer breaks your off on Fridays.
cons: Very over complicated process just to process a student.

pros: I can use all of my previous skills to do the job and I am helping people that really need help to make the transition.
cons: The college needs to do much more advertising to establish its brand, to establish the things that are different, unique and special

pros: Talking to students, coworkers, hbcu environment
cons: Director did not give me breaks, forced me to drive to multiple schools (7) concussed in 1 week, made fun of my hair, eyelashes, skin tone, asked me to do her PhD homework for her, told other employees I was quiting when I wasn't and attempted to punch me repeatedly. HR did not care about anything because soro sisters with management, &out of date record keeping circa 2005.

job_title: Director, Admissions and Recruitment in Memphis, TN
pros: The College over its 155 year history has provided a lot of positive career opportunities for its graduates.
cons: The College totally underpays its faculty and staff salaries.  The College current Administration does not appreciate and value its Faculty, Staff, and Students.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Memphis, TN
pros: Not too big, you get to make an impact if you take your job responsibilities seriously. Good benefits. Not too uptight.
cons: Not enough automated processes. But it's progressing in the right direction.

pros: Friendly staff and students are nice too.
cons: Takes a while to get things done.
Lots of manual inputs, it department not up to par
